Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: tfitz22
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I stayed two nights and I think I paid around $180, but I want my money back!! The casino was closed, the pool was pathetic and closes at 6pm, no hot tub (even though it was advertised as having one) and the room was disgusting. We walked in and immediately noticed the disgusting smell, they had defrosted the mini fridge and left a wet towel dangling out of it so the room smelled of mildew (among other smells). I was afraid to walk on the carpet for fear of catching a disease, so we kept our flip flops on whenever walking around, even in the shower. There was an inexplicable leak in the bathroom, it seemed everytime we turned on the sink or took a shower there was a large puddle on the floor! The bed was hard as a rock, the slider door going onto the patio didnt close properly so we couldn't lock it and the noise from the street cannot be blocked by closing the slider, it almost got louder. The curtains had holes so you couldn't even try to block out the sun. They asked for a security deposit of $25 cash which is ridiculous, how could we make the room any worse?!? We had to buy a candle so we wouldn't want to vomit whenever we walked in the room. OH and there was a hole in our ceiling leading to the pipes which rattled horribly loud whenever the AC was on. Also no internet even though it was advertised to have it. I hope I didn't forget anything, bottom line, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY PALACE!”
Reviews.Author: bridgetotheworld
Reviews.Content: In all my years of traveling have I not seen a "hotel" as bad and with terrible "service" to match it. Let me be clear when I say that I have been to Beautiful Puerto Rico many times and everyone has been absolutely Wonderful so this review is specifically directed to the dis service provided by Mr Ayala(General Manager) and the " Diamond Palace". Can Someone Please Correct me if im Crazy... But I check in with my wife and 6 month old daughter for what was supposed to be a lengthy stay, we enter the room and it is absolutely filthy( i knew that it wasnt a 5 star hotel but this is rediculous) im talking about throw up on the carpet, unknown stains on the bed sheets, the toilet was over flown etc etc... I go down stairs to the front desk and kindly tell Mr. Figueroa who then calls "Mr Ayala" to whom I expressed that all we wanted was to be changed to a clean room(we didnt want a refund or an upgrade or anything else for that matter) just a clean room and his response to me was, we cant guarantee that, and I asked you cant guarantee what???(double beds, the view) what??? and he looks at me and says the cleanliness and I said EXCUSE ME!?!?!?!?! How can you be in the Hospitality business and not offer someone something as Basic as a clean room?... And he says your in a "standard room' let me send someone upstairs to see whats the Big Problem and we'll call you, You all know how this ended... This Mr Ayala is certainly in the wrong business and truly should be Fired because im sure were not the 1st or last to come in contact with him. So whoever is the owner of this place please take some action here for the sake of your own business and reputation. If not I strongly suggest that the Puerto Rico tourism board look into closing this place down specially when your surrounded by such Beautiful Resorts & People, then caught up in the middle of this is the Nasty Palace!..

Reviews.Title: “Would have rather slept on the Street”
Reviews.Author: titanfan03
Reviews.Content: I can say this was the worse place ever. How it is still in buisness i dont know. Casino was not available but besides that we didnt even stay one night we left the 1st night and when we asked for a manager one was not available to us. We called for about 4 days straight and still no manage available. The room was dirty there was a hole by the sliding doors that masquitos where getting into the tv was held up by a strap mold in the bathroom wooden board under the mattress and mildew smell everywhere. Resturant was closed when we got there pool was dirty. I had my 7month old and there was no way we where putting her in danger. Finally got a manager explained everything and i appealed the charges and got my money back. Next time ill go to an actual hotel that is known

Reviews.Title: “Run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: carro66
Reviews.Content: This is the crappiest hotel ever. Thank good we only stayed for one night. It was filthy, dirty, the elevators didnÂ´t work our friends got stuck i the basement in the heat. We couldnÂ´t get a knife for the butter we were suggested a spoon. The casino was closed, the pool was dirty, and the staff was less then friendly. Put a few extra dollars on another hotel please. I know people say you get what you pay for but this was a freaky experience. The best thing was that even the cockroaches had abandoned the building.

Reviews.Title: “Run away as fast as you can from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravellandToronto
Reviews.Content: I totally agreed to all the bad reviews on this hotel. A travel agent booked this hotel for us at the rate of $118.00 (Cdn dollars almost at par) per night prior to and after a cruise. What a let down! I didn't want to step on the carpet barefooted or to sit down on the chairs. The bathroom ceiling was leaking. My husband was the repairman to the broken shower handle. There was a big hole with exposed pipes in the closet ceiling, granted, we should look straight not up when hanging clothes. We could not read in the dim-lighted room that we went to bed at 7:00p.m. We requested a wake-up-call at 4:30 a.m. for a 7:00a.m. flight, fortunately the noisy street and other guests didn't allow us sleep in. When checking out, the soundly asleep front-desk-clerk needed our wake-up-call instead. The moral of this story is: don't count on anybody but yourself!

Reviews.Title: “we called the elevator sparky!!--we had fun...”
Reviews.Author: silentonbordeaux
Reviews.Content: i read all the review on here before we went--and all the things that were written we SAW TOO!!--the elevator almost took out my girl like three times--beware ladies..lol--very hard bed--closed down casino--closed down fancy restraunt(on top on tower)the last night the ceiling was leaking from a.c. we used trash can to catch it...sneaky....the maid service was excellent however--no theft---and the view from our room 411 was amazing--and when u needed to take a break from being on the go--chilling on the little padio in our room having a few drinks was a great time, watching the craziness on the street below--the fort "el morro" is a short taxi ride away--i highly recomend it--and the best beach close to diamond palace is --" isle verde"--short cab ride as well--and well worth it--the rain forest trip is available right across the street at the marriot--and is pretty short money 60 dollars --REALLY nice --and the marriot casino is OPEN !!--the ambassador is right down the road and it has a very nice casino as well--check out their upstairs restaraunt real good----getting a drink at the casino's in puerto rico was quite a chore--unless u went out to the bar which was EXPENSIVE-- but overall the diamond palace served our needs and we had the time of our lives--but we will stay somewhere else next time... p.s. the cab drivers are NUT'S--hightly entertaining.... enjoy your trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Run away”
Reviews.Author: dischick
Reviews.Content: Despite having orignally booked to stay at the Marriott in San Juan, our cruise coordinator recommended that our large group (over 50, varying ages, including small children), stay at the Diamond Palace (to get a better rate, which wasn't very good). While the lobby was clean, the rooms were another story. 1) The toilets have a strip of paper indicating that they have been cleaned. On closer inspection, we found a pubic hair and some sort of slimy gunk on the seat. 2) The rooms were literally sweating, you could see condensation on the walls. 3) One of the young children, woke up with some sort of insect in his ear. 4) The rooms were outdated, and had a bit of an odd smell to them. Granted, this was in 2007, so hopefully things have changed (but from reading recent reviews, it hasn't). Thank goodness we only had to stay here for one night.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, colorful and entertaining”
Reviews.Author: far0ut
Reviews.Content: Staying in Diamond Palace Hotel & Casino was quite an experience as it was our welcoming to Puerto Rico: simple yet quite comfortable, colorful and entertaining. We found it for an excellent price in Last minute travel web site and we felt very lucky.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant dive hotel - what you pay for is what you get”
Reviews.Author: hoser9
Reviews.Content: I am a 24 year old male airline employee. I do lots of leisure travel, I have been out of town for 50 days this year, and about 25 of those were in hotel rooms. I stay in lots of types of places, from the 5* Mandarin Oriental on a US$70 airline employee rate to a $60 penthouse two bedroom and living room suite at the lovely 1* Gold Spike Hotel. Look, this is a dive hotel located in an area where the cheapest we could get (on airline employee rate) was $200 a night. Yes, there are flaws in the room, like a rust stain on the mirror, old uneven furniture, only TWO towels per room, and old carpet and tiles. But the important things prevailed: it had a huge fridge that was cold and quiet. The air conditioning was very powerful and not very loud. The room was obviously well cleaned. We didn't see any roaches or pests. The linens were fresh and the mattress was hard; just the way I like it. There was no stench in the room. The water pressure was good and had hot water. That's all I care about. A bonus was the television that had 45 us channels with great reception (yessss, adult swim) and free local calls. The pool area is crappy if you want to sunbathe, there was only about 2 hours where the sun wasn't hiding behind some tower. The pool itself, is, interesting. There used to be a hot tub but they converted it into a smaller pool that has a waterfall type thing that flows into the main pool. The pool is DEEP (another thing going extinct these days...thanks, insurance companies) and COLD but smelled like those plastic kiddie pools that you fill with a garden hose. It just smelled like it didn't have much chlorine in it. The staff looked very surprised that I had jumped in it, and come to think of it, I didn't see anyone go into it. The staff, yes, were old. But I have no problem with senior citizens seeking employment. They all did their job well, and to be honest, I prefer an 80 year old bellhop than some 20 year old kid. I'm ageist, I know. I tipped the bellhop $2 to hold our two carry on sized bags, and he was more than happy to stand under the sun hailing a cab for us afterward. The checkin agent was also very old but was very helpful when he didn't see the reservation we made on Orbtiz 8 hours before checkin. He said he would deal with orbitz after checking us in, instead of making us wait while he did paperwork. He also checked us in 3 hours before the designated checkin, which is very rare for dive hotels. This hotel exists in a quickly gentrifying area and it would be interesting to see what they do. To be honest, I hope they just leave it the way it is, they have at least another 5 years without doing any renos. If you want a Marriott, go to the Marriott next door. This place is great if you use your room for sleeping, not for living, 'cause, y'know, there's a beach a block away. It's clean, it's quiet, it's comfortable. It just isn't aesthetically pleasing. Enjoy San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Diamond Palace but...”
Reviews.Author: Catguy
Reviews.Content: I come stay at this hotel about twice a year because of it's price and location. It's run down and sort of trapped in a time warp because it is fading as years go by. No interest or money to invest in it's much needed areas but I still manage to enjoy my stay here. I only once saw a dead roach in my closet but have never stayed in one of those horrible rooms that other persons have even posted pictures. I guess I've been one of the lucky few who get good rooms with almost everything working. My main interest anyways is good air conditioning, cleanliness and hot water; those have never lacked. Yes, very old people work here but I have nothing against senior citizens still working. As long as the rates are cheap I can manage to stay here without complaints and I payed about $70 plus taxes. My last day here the breakfast lady did not show up to place the cheap continental breakfast but I really didn't care and went to Wendy's just a block away. In spite of the bad raps, the price and location is just right for me for a quick get-away to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “awful... black water and funky smell.”
Reviews.Author: marcitos812
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever. Not only did they charge almost $100 which is higher than many of the local B&B's but the rooms were terrible. The beds were from the 60's and the whole hotel smeled strange. The casino was closed and breakfast ended early. (ie when we got down there they had already cleaned up when it wasn't supposed to end for another hour) The water from our shower came out black then orange and when we asked them what was going on they said it was still 'clean' and that they were doing some pipe maintenance. We still asked for another room, and got it, but it wasn't any better than the first.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Soon2Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to give this hotel a try since its in a great location and the prices are reasonable. However, you will get what you pay for. What surprised us is this hotel has great potential because of this location but its outdated and not maintained. One of the elevators was not operating normally which made the wait much longer especially when you're on the 11th floor. The room was not clean at least to our standards. We didn't even attempt their breakfast. You're better off going to another place. If your looking for a great location with a good price then this hotel is for you other than that, do your research.

Reviews.Title: “Roches Roches Roches Roches Dont stay, Run”
Reviews.Author: selani
Reviews.Content: The hotel isS nasty nasty!!!!!!! we asked for a ocaen view what a joke.dont eat the breakfast i saw were it was made in the basement in a small parkin garage with the roches nasty the place smell it was damp musty paint chipping just a bad bad place it should be closed for good . the casino closed down for good never stay here run fast price was good thats all you get what u pay for to top it off parking is 13.00

Reviews.Title: “Just Say NO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iamchristopher
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Diamond Palace Hotel and Casino during the July 4th weekend. I read Trip Advisor about the hotel before I stayed. The hotel already received a very low rating, but I was still hoping for the best. Well, let me tell you, the hotel didnâ€™t disappoint. The shower head didnâ€™t work properly and it only took a minor touch of the shower faucet to go from hot to cold. One of the elevators would pass the floor about two inches and acted like hydraulics to become even to the floor. During my second day the lobby was flooded with water. I didnâ€™t care to ask why. I was watching TV under covers and enjoying the peace. Suddenly, a little brown friend ran on top of the sheets and winked at me. I almost passed out that a roach would be crawling on my sheets. Ugh! Oh, and the staff is rude. The maid service would walk into the room without knocking. The front desk would argued with me when I had a complaint or ask a question. Terrible!!! My friend booked this hotel. Never again! Well, I will say that it was cheap and two blocks from the beach. Whew hew. Not! Oh, and the air conditioner worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare from start to finish never stay here!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hunbug7
Reviews.Content: We have taken so long to write this review as we have only just got over the trauma of our stay here. When we arrived the room was ok. The childrens pull out bed was not made up considering we arrived at 11pm. We had to wait ages for the bedding to arrive and when it did we had to make our own bed up. The bed was so unsafe it had metal prongs sticking out of it everywhere that my husband would not allow my children to sleep in it so he slept in it. Half way through the night there was an almighty crash and water dripping. My husband lept out of bed he thought someone had come in the room. He went in the bathroom to find it flooded with water. The air conditioning unit which is above ceiling above the wardrobe in the bathroom had been letting water out onto the suspended ceiling and had got too heavy for the ceiling that the ceiling collapsed. This was obviously not the first time this had happened as their was brown water marks on the ceiling. Lucky our clothes were not in the wardrobe. My husband mopped it up as well as he could with towels as we didn't want to disrupt the family sleeping. The next morning we told the manager and he seemed unconcerned as if 'so what'. All staff were unfriendly and unapproachable. Breakfast was comical as none of the staff spoke to you, just pointed at food and slapped it on your plate. We were going on a cruise so was very pleased to be leaving this hell hole. Unfortunately we were staying here after the cruise ended before we flew home. We came to check in for our second stay, 5 minutes before check in time. The unfriendly lady on the desk pointed at the clock and carried on with what she was doing. When we asked to have a room in the same area as last time as the view was probably the best you could find from the hotel we were told that our previous room was an upgrade!! Can you imagine what we thought our room was going to be like this time? The toilet in the 2nd room leaked constantly although the only thing good about this was that the toilet and bathroom was cleaned to the best the cleaner could do with room. The lifts stopped when you called them and smelt like electrical burning. They were quite scary and we ended up carrying our luggage down the stairs as we didn't want to use the lifts. IF YOU WANT A NICE STAY, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! YOU WILL WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “A roach infested dump”
Reviews.Author: Eggs_Benedict
Reviews.Content: A roach infested room, wet carpet, ac not working, paint peeling. Not suitable for human habitation. Questionable characters in the lobby and elevator. Smell of urine in hallways.,

Reviews.Title: “INTERESTING OVERALL WITH SOMEWHAT OF TRADITIONAL LOCALS”
Reviews.Author: Carr3203
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott a couple of times and the Canairo's and Holiday Inn Express and some others. I decided to try this place as for the price it was good not to mention the location. Yes, the facility is old and in need of more updating and just some basic painting. However, the staff all good and helpful. My room a nice delux room was clean and attended to each and every day. O,I must say I was sort of scared as I like most read all the visitors reviews. However,for a real touch of old traditional PR hotel along with most locals from around the island. I did fine it a interesting and a safe visit. Yes, the elavators at times require one to take a step up to get off. But if that is not much of an issue try this place. As most others around there in Condado are mostly visitors like myself from outside of PR. I had most of my meals in the local places as I go to PR for the cultural experiences. As well as enjoying the beach just a three minute walk. I do understand the Diamond is sold for potential tearing down for new condo's /hotel. So I suspect this particular experience in the Condado section will be one of the past. However, I have found it to be OK and interesting. I have been to several places in diffenent parts of the world and so for me not all that bad. If you are one who is not all that flexable and looking for the Marriott experience then it is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / No No to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: latinaccent01
Reviews.Content: I will start on a positive note. We arrived at 11 AM and check in is at 3PM we were able to check- in no questions asked. We had a room upgrade at no extra charge . Good view and a small balcony. The beach is less than one block away. The people who worked there were very helpful and gave us good tips on where to go for a drink and nightlife fun. The small cafe by the pool is good and cheap less than $6 for a meal and a drink. Great patties. OK, Now here is the negative side of this hotel. The pool is small and only gets clean in the morning, As you can guess by the afternoon is full of leaves. Needless to say I didn't jump in onece. The hotel is in need of lots of repairs. One of their buildings was under construction. The room furniture is old and falling apart. The lamps light buld don't work. Safes are not available in the room. The bathrooms are in poor conditons. The hair dryer and faucit were rusty. The cleaning lady came in several times without knocking. The basic stuff were not given no conditioner or soap. Thank you, Wallgreens for being right across the street. I also found a shoe that was left behind by another guess in the room. The left elevator got stuck several times at night during my stay. You've been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Diamond Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: nena8173
Reviews.Content: This place was a dump. Sorry I really don't like to say that especially because I love Puerto Rico so much, but if you stay here you will not enjoy your trip to PR. Some people are saying come on for the price it's not that bad. Tripadvisor lists it as $89 Now. But when I went we payed $150 per night, which is a normal price in San Juan but you can get a way better hotel for that. This place has roaches all over. It was old, run down and dirty. Then we told the management and he said 'Hey what do you expect for $150?" Are you serious? I expect ALOT better than this. I told him I was leaving and to refund me for the nights we didn't stay. PS- We then went to Embassy Suites Dorado and payed about $180 for a complete 360. Wow so much better!

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnajh
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a cruise. The room had ants. would not stay again. The smell was bad. Raleigh, NC

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrible Place In The World”
Reviews.Author: mj43
Reviews.Content: When I First Stepped in theFront Door and Saw the old 150 ,Year old man taken bags to the mess up elevator, I was in shock, it smelled like a old smelly mildew carpet, every employee had on old hand me down uniforms , look like some old Sammy Davis Jr From the 1930's the rooms was all mess up with roaches running around, the room smelling like doodo,the pillows make your head itch like hell. we left and they had the balls to get mad at us for leaving that dump.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there under ANY circumnstances”
Reviews.Author: beachvisitor
Reviews.Content: Believe previous bad reviews. This place is a DUMP!!! It is horrible, falling apart, smelly (mold, urine), dirty, and just BAD NEWS. The lobby looks dark and spooky. Elevators are noisy and appear unreliable. The rooms are in terrible condition, furniture is missing, furniture in the room is old and stained, there is dust everywhere. Curtains, lamps and walls are torn and with paint chipping away. The television did not work (static). The shower had no pressure, so I had to bathe leaning on the wall, plus the water was cold. Totally true what others are writing about the breakfast, a huge joke, there is one woman toasting bread and offering a pathetic ?ham and cheese sandwich, with what appeared to be neither ham nor cheese (I passed!), and alternatives are cereal with mushy bananas or ?juice (basically paint and artificial flavor). We complained to the person at the reception, who said nothing, not even that she was sorry we had had such a bad experience. This place in unbelievable... we are going to call American Express and complain bitterly about their recommendation, and their supposed 3 star rating!?!?

Reviews.Title: “A Filthy Dump”
Reviews.Author: nycboytroy
Reviews.Content: I went to this place about 5 years ago and decided to go back last summer. The place haven't had a face lift in God knows how long. The management let the place fall to pieces. The pillow had mildew the floor was dirty and mildew on the shower curtain and in the cieling. Would not recomend this place to no one. Orbitz seem to always have the dump places listed on thier website. Never had a good experience with them. Another place to avoid booking on Orbitz is Regent Palace in London, Piccadilly Circus. That is a Royal DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Diamond Palace............(UGHHHH)”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyPing
Reviews.Content: The Diamond Palace should be called "A Lump of Coal!" You can tell this place is a dump the minute you walk in. I was actually surprised that there were people in the lobby and casino. We stayed a total of 1 hour at this dump. We were skeptically taken to our room and immediately turned around after we were given a room with one full size bed. Our original reservation was for two queen size beds. Fortunatly for us we were able to argue our way out of our reservation and get our money back. There was no way that I was going to feel safe in this place as the doors to the rooms looked like they could have been kicked down in second. We were instructed to park our car in the back lot a ways down the dark alley. I would have preferred to sleep on the beach than to stay in this place. Fortunately for us we were able to run, not walk to the Sheraton down the street and book a room there for the night.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: hobancoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be demolished. The name is certainly a misnomer: it has nothing to do with either diamonds or palaces. You know as soon as you arrive, from the outside, that the joint is a shambles. The reception staff (except for the pleasant cleaning ladies) are surly and lazy. The rooms are decrepit; ancient beds that sag; threadbare blankets; sinks without stoppers. We had to move our room because of severe plumbing problems. And, to top it off, on the last day of our stay, the electricity was off, which meant that the room was stifling and dark. As for the continental breakfast, don't bother. If you take breakfast, say, at 9 a.m., you'll find that the coffee had been made at 5 a.m. Watery "juices", a couple of pre-packaged cereal items, sometimes bananas and always apples. The lady who would make your toast would also make fun of you. When asked, when we wanted a late check-out due to the time lost in changing rooms, we were sternly told by the cold-faced man at the front desk, "no". Do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “needs work”
Reviews.Author: msbrown122901
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs alot of work. Rooms smell musty and there was cockroaches. Staff gladly moved our room after complaining about the one we originally had. This place does smell like pee when you walk in. We had a pleasant experience. The only nice thing about the location of this hotel was it was within walking distance to the beach. If you have a car good lucfk as you will be charged 13.00 a day to park in the lot behind the hotel.(eventhough the hotel has a parking garage) I would strongly suggest checking out other hotels in the area before going to this one.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth the low price”
Reviews.Author: teddybear_ang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that horrible. The staff was very friendly. They always openeed the door for us and said hello. The elevator is quite old and we refused to use it. It would stop at ourfloor, it would be about 3ft(at it's worse) away from the floor, we would have to step up into it. We usually sent it back up and hoped to get the other one. Be ware, the parking(which no one tells you until you are there) is $13 a day!!! This was a huge suprise and did not make us happy. We ended up getting groceries to make up for it so we wouldn't eat out. Then on the day of our check they tried charing us a "city tax" of $5/day per person. They ended up waiving this when we griped about the parking fee as well. The rooms were well kept except that there were little ants in the bathroom, we bought bug spray for ourselves and used it on the bathroom. Overall it was just fine but be ware of all the hidden fees. Wal greens is directly across the street which was awesome and the beach is literally across the street and was very warm.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at Diamond Palace!”
Reviews.Author: jessreads
Reviews.Content: For some reason, I chose to ignore the reviews I had read, and decided to take a chance and stay at the Diamond Palace. I was so, so wrong. From the second I walked in through the dingy doors, the smell that was hanging in the air and the dirt stained sofa told me that I had made a horrible mistake. Seeing the poor state of the hotel, my family urged me to inspect a room before finalizing my reservation. I did, and that was the best decision I could have made. Long story short, this hotel is absolutely filthy and in complete disprepair. It is a shame that people actually pay money to stay here, and good money at that. We left the same night. Please don't make the same mistake I did, and steer clear of this awful place!

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a $20 hostel in Eastern Europe”
Reviews.Author: boardride654
Reviews.Content: Yes it IS that bad. I spent a month backpacking through Europe staying at $20/night hostels, and this place is by far worse than any hostel I've ever stayed at. Let me preface this with a little about my hotel standards. I just graduated from college. I'm used to staying in el-cheapo hotels for spring break, summer vacation, etc. Usually all I care about is a place to pass out with a bed. This, however, was the worst hotel I have EVER been to. And, for the first time in my life, I checked into a hotel and checked right back out. I don't need to list everything wrong with this hotel... read the other reviews for that, as I wish I had as well. In short, the room completely falling apart, the bed hard as a rock, I got stuck in an elevator for 10 minutes, when the elevator did finally work it stopped between floors, etc.. I honestly thought the elevator was going to plummet. There's a reason this is a cheap [-] hotel. Honestly, $30 bux more a night and stay at the Holiday Inn Express or some other decent place. I checked out and went to the Marriott where I ended up paying $200/night but it was worth it. I have no idea how this place stays in business. They need some investors to fork up some $$$ and do repairs, because the place should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have limited funds.”
Reviews.Author: Moncho1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in bad shape. Since I went trough the front door I could sense that the stay was not going to be excellent. The staff at the front desk were helpful. The room was a bit worn out, but it was comfortable. The ac was excellent so was having a small refrigerator. The breakfast was very basic, but I would not recommend because of lack of cleanliness and rude staff. You can go outside and there are many places u can have an excellent breakfast for little money. The pool was not very appealing. The best thing the hotel has it is the location. Have to be the best in all of SJ. If u can afford stay at the Condado Plaza better stay but more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Save half your money, ignore a little mold!”
Reviews.Author: GaelicHead
Reviews.Content: I went to Puerto Rico to help my son find an apartment for himself and his bride-to-be. This hotel fell into our price range a LOT better than the nearly next door Marriott Hotel did, and the location was great. I chose to ignore the reviews. I hope you will read mine, as Diamond Palace deserves a chance. When you walk in the front door, it is almost like stepping into a movie set of the era of the Rat Pack. I expected Dean Martin to come swaggering over from the lounge at any moment. The lobby is clean, and the Casino, while small, was usually busy and always protected by at least one extra from the set of The Sopranos. To the left of the lobby was the Lounge, with an appropriately dark and swanky bar, where Bingo was often in action. In the evening there was often live music, or karaoke. A walk out the door at the end of the lounge area brought us right out on the main street, and a right hand turn brought us to a Haagen-Daas AND a Starbucks, both with a high-speed internet access. So it was easy to get online. As far as the rooms go, the beds were a little hard for my liking, and the pillows were not great. But the sheets were clean. The rooms were in bad shape. There was bubbling of the ceiling both over the bed, and a lot of it over the shower--both were moldy. It is always humid in Puerto Rico, and I suspect when there is no one in a room, the air conditioning is off, thus the mold. But the countertop in the small bathroom was clean. We just stopped looking up. There was a free refrigerator in the closet in the room, and with a 24 hour Walgreen's directly across the street, we saved a ton by keeping drinks and some food in there. There was also a free safe in there, though we had no valuables. It was only ONE BLOCK to the beach!! When we had trouble with our air conditioning, they responded immediately. I mean NOW. Everyone was friendly and helpful. If we asked, they responded. We did not eat in the restaurant, but it seemed like lots of people came to the hotel just to eat there. We also did not swim in the hotel, though many families were and they were all smiles. I asked for extra towels in the room on the first day and Housekeeping remembered every day after that. So fear not the Diamond Palace. I enjoyed my 8 days there and would stay there again. And I am usually a 5 star only gal.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time ...People need to stop the Bull”
Reviews.Author: cuddlyasacat
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the Diamond Palace Hotel & Casino was in 2004. When I read the reviews that people wrote since then I was nervous and considered changing my reservations. "I AM GLAD I DIDN'T ! " We arrived at the Diamond Palace at 8:30 pm and was greeted by the doorman, checked-in and escorted to our room, which was fully air-conditioned. Our room was not fancy , but it was clean and cozy. We stayed there for 7 days and enjoyed the daily lunches at the pool side for $5.75. The Greenhouse Cafe , which is located inside the Hotel was fabulous also. Every Night we went down to the Casino which was always occupied with happy people and the sirens of jack Pot winners. I must say that our stay at the Diamond Palace Hotel & Casino was great and would recommend it to Friends ..........Word of Advice " Please do not listen to all he reviews it can really louse up your vacation before you even get to your destination ... " P.S * Staff at the Diamonfd Palace Hotel & Casino were great and very Helpful.*

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Roach Motel Had to Call the Cops”
Reviews.Author: Trev2003
Reviews.Content: WOW where to start? Just when you think things can't get any worse... I booked this hotel on Hotwire, and that was my first mistake because I couldn't read the horrible reviews already posted on trip advisor. Hotwire is the ONLY way this place stays in business. Arrived at the Roach Palace, and checked in. The individuals at the front desk are so rude and snotty you would swear they are doing you a favor by letting you stay there. After the fourth unacceptable room (mold, roaches in the curtains, dead roaches on the floor, horrible bathrooms, etc. etc. etc.) they had taken us to, I went back down and requested that the information with my credit card number on it be given back to me because we wouldn't be staying the night. They refused to give me back MY personal Information. I had to call the Cops to have them turn over my credit card number, because the front desk was so rude and argumentative. I was so horrified that a place like this was in business I called the local health board DOCA, and filed a complaint. Do Not Stay Here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff let themselves into our room at 7am!”
Reviews.Author: madameadele
Reviews.Content: I could rant and rave about this place for hours, but i'll just give you the cliff notes. Arrived at 3pm to be told check-in wasn't until 4 (even though my confirmation said 3pm), didn't get our room keys until 4:50pm. No it wasn't busy. The staff was just lazy, rude and completely disrespectful. There were holes in the ceiling of our room, brown stuff all over the walls, and soiled sheets (you don't even want to know, just trust me, they were DIRTY), the room had the most disgusting stench ever. The pool water was cloudy. I gave my credit card as a deposit for a safe lock, was assured that it was free and that they wouldn't charge my card unless it wasn;t returned. They charged my card $75, which I didn't know about until after my trip. I called, and noone could help me... amazing. The thing that sealed the deal for me, my husband, friend and I left the room to go down to breakfast, leaving our one friend in the room... She was getting out of the shower and opened the bathroom door because she thought she had heard us come back in, instead she found a hotel employee (not housekeeping either) lookin directly at her and then he ran out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been in - Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: FabioT
Reviews.Content: I have been in more than 100 different hotels and this one was BY FAR the WORST hotel I ever been in. Just a quick list of problems in this terrible hotel: - Dirty. The room and the bathroom were in terrible state - Old. The room and the hotel needs obvious repairs - Terrible service. Most of times, nobody picks up the phone when you call the front desk from your room or from outside the hotel - They did not call my room (wake-up call) and I almost lost an appointment - Elevator is scary. It is extremely slow, never stops on the same level of its floor and sometimes hangs there for almost one minute before opening the door. I am concerned it can be a serious hazard to the guests - Nobody on duty on the parking lot when I had to leave to the airport in the morning - At last but not least: Disorganized and DISHONEST. They charged my credit card TWICE over ONE MON TH ago. I sent all receipts proving that they overcharged me and I have wasted several hours calling them and asking them to solve the problem. I got nothing so far. They are extremely INCOMPETENT and I would NEVER consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan cheapie”
Reviews.Author: midas6t6
Reviews.Content: We flew to San Juan the day before leaving on a cruise and wanted someplace reasonable to stay overnight. We've done this several times before and the Diamond Palace was on a par with the other places we've stayed (Comfort Inn, for one). Hotel definitely needs some TLC - the web site implies it is new but it's got to be at least 20 years old. Maids clean as well as they can but carpets need cleaning and our room at least needed some spackle and paint. Bed was clean, breakfast selection, while meager, was better than any other of the hotels we've stayed in. Desk staff was indifferent to hostile - when we checked out another couple was questioning the rate charged since it differed from their reservation rate and were accused of being troublemakers; no adjustment to their rate offered. Overall if you're looking for a cheap (for San Juan) place to spend a night or two it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: GrammaP
Reviews.Content: Our cruise travel agent booked us into this hotel for two nights prior to our cruise. We wanted to do some San Juan sightseeing before we left. The hotel was a bit seedy. It was clean and we didn't see any bugs as some other reviews mentioned. Our balcony was shaky....don't lean on the rail, but surprisingly, the street noise wasn't too bad. The continental breakfast was kinda funny....toast and cheese/balony sandwiches, coffee/tea and cereal. The casino was tiny and the bar was almost deserted. The restraunt on site was our only option when we got there after 11 pm, and it cost us over $40 to have a light meal before going to bed (after starving on the airplane). Having a Walgreen's across the street was a great benefit for snacks, water, etc. Taxis were readily available but a bit spendy to go see the sights. It was a do-able place to stay, but for the money, I would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Puzzled”
Reviews.Author: jrags0951
Reviews.Content: We needed a cheap hotel in San Juan to crash since our flight landed at Midnight. I wanted a 24 hour front desk. This one came up at $115 per night and I booked it. We arrived by taxi and checked in. The casino seemed to be about 40 feet by 40 feet. The adjacent bar had a local singer who played loud enought to be heard in Miami. The front desk seemed to have a small ability to speak english. We were tired so we checked in anyway. We were given a room on the third floor and I was worried about sound from the bar. When we tried to use the elevator, none of the lights worked so I wasn't sure about whether it would get us there or not. Anyway the key card wouldn't work to let us in the room. I suspect it was rented already. From the looks of the outside, I suspected it was as large as a cruise ship cabin. I went back to the front desk and I suspect he thought I saw the room and was rejecting it. So he moved us to a suite on the 7th floor for the same price. The suite had a balcony I had to force the sliding glass doors open to access. The room was expansive and the bed comfortable. It was just set up strangely. It was as if it had been something else at one time. One door opened up to a two foot square space with a mirror. The kitchen had all the appliances, but they were arranged strangely. While I can't really complain, it was weird. The hotel is just across from the beach and your aren't far from the Marriott. The hotel fit my bill, but I don't think it would have with the original room The continenal breakfast was cereal and a ham sandwich?

Reviews.Title: “It is...what it is..!”
Reviews.Author: cbcito
Reviews.Content: Alright....I returned earlier in the week from an extended weekend in San Juan, staying at the Diamond Palace. It was a last minute deal through Expedia at $89 a night. (Which is about what you should pay for a room there.) I had been there before so I knew what I was getting into. (If you scroll back to 2005 you can read a rather candid review I gave of the place.) Speaking on my experience only; I had no problems with it the entire weekend. My room was in the north tower on the 4th floor. I had a king size bed and a small balcony with a partial view of the Ocean. True, the room obviously had not been made over in several years, but there was nothing gruesome, like mold or holes in the walls. (Nor was I mauled by roaches or bedbugs.) Check-in was surprisingly smooth. I didn't arrive til nearly 2am thanks to airline delays, but I checked in with them from JFK and kept them posted. When I arrived there was someone at the desk waiting, and I was upstairs rather quickly. All my light fixtures and power outlets worked, as did the TV and remote. Air conditioning was a thermostat, so it wasn't noisy at all and all the settings worked. I also had ample hot water...so all in all there was not much to complain about. If you are a youngish, single traveler looking for a budget place to crash for a weekend; I would say it's adequate..depending on the price. (I wouldn't spend over $100 a night for it though.) However..if this is your "dream vacation"; a family affair, or if you are the type of traveler who spends a lot of time within the hotel...this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunately the reviews are right on”
Reviews.Author: kimerama
Reviews.Content: Not updated. Not renovated. Not particularly clean. Staff not particularly friendly. Nothing to say except stay away. If you already booked try booking another hotel. Even losing the money you already paid (if you can't cancel) is worth it if you can avoid this place. That's what we did, we had reservations here and then wound up staying at the Radisson. Not even worth the drama.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: YankeeGirl11
Reviews.Content: I went to PR for a wedding. I didn't bother to check any reviews on this hotel since the wedding reception was AT the hotel, and I figured someone that was planning the wedding surely had taken a look at the hotel first. WRONG. The night before I was to leave for PR, I looked at some reviews here and was instantly afraid. The morning my cab came to get me, my instincts told me to grab my credit card...."just in case". Thank the Good LORD I did. We pulled up to the hotel and sort of said "Hmmmm....well, can't be THAT bad". The woman at the front desk was too busy fixing the copier to help me for the first 15 minutes of me standing there. Our rooms weren't ready so we said, ok, we'll go to the pool. UM. Wrong again. The pool is the size of my closet and the building is so tall and surrounded by tall building that you'd never get any sun, no matter which corner to you sat in! The little food serving station at the pool was reviewed to be fabulous but I honestly wasn't comfortable eating anything that came from there. So we went across the street to the Argentinian Bar and Grill. Now THAT place is fabulous. Great food, drinks and service. Finally, we are allowed into our room. It was enough to make you cry. The carpet was dirty. The walls were dingy. The sofa I had planned on sleeping on (I was sharing the room with 2 other people) looked filthy. We turned around, went across the street to the Marriott and they helped us get a room at the Marriott Miramar. I am not the type that is VERY particular but I do expect my hotels to be clean. If you want to enjoy your stay in PR, stay anywhere but here. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRNyc
Reviews.Content: We usually stay with relatives when we visit PR but we decided to stay right in the middle of all the action in San Juan. We knew that this was a travel budget hotel. It looked very clean and cozy online and we figured we wouldn't spent much time actually there anyway since we had a full itinerary for every day of our stay (The package included a car rental). We thought it was great that it also included a pool, a couple of restaurants and a casino. We were extremely dissapointed. The rooms were musty and moldy. The casino and lobby reeked of cigarette smoke. The hotel seemed to be falling apart all around us. To top it all off we arrived there late in the day and our room was not yet ready. We proceeded to grab a snack at the restaurant by the pool. We noticed that the cooks at the grill's clothing was very greasy and dirty. we figured it must have been a very long day. The very next day when we came down to the pool these women had on the same exact greasy sweaty clothing. Needless to say we never ate on the premises again. We made the most of our stay by exploring the nearby hotels, casinos, restaurants and the natural beauty of this wonderful island. We also visited friends and relatives. We would NEVER EVER stay in this place again!! They need to tear the place down and rebuild from the ground up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: IslandTravels42
Reviews.Content: I too was skeptical about booking at the Diamond Palace after reading the reviews but I had already booked 10 airplane tickets and needed a hotel. I called the hotel directly and spoke with Millie in reservations. She provided great information and was quite helpful. Our party of 10 consisted of ages 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 22, 26, 27, 42 and 46 quite a range of ages and needs. When we arrived at the Diamond Palace a Bellman was right outside to help us even though we all had rolling luggage. Carlos at the front desk was friendly and admitted right up front he was new but everything would be fine. He helped us adjust our original reservation to accommodate all 10 of us. We ended up on the 9th floor North tower. We had 3 king suites with pull out couches and a roll away. It was great! We had the whole floor to ourselves, could leave our doors open so the kids could move around and had enough TVâ€™s and refrigerators and showers for everybody. When we went out to dinner I requested with a note to the front desk, since they were quite busy checking people in, for extra pillows, towels, and a roll away bed. When we returned not only had everything been delivered the sofa bed was out and made up as well as the roll away bed. The 24 hour Walgreens is right across the street so when we needed band aides or a candy bar it was close. The rooms were cleaned everyday and we found everybody to be friendly. I did see a lot of security in the hotel but no more than I have seen at the Marriott or the Radisson which are on the same street. My grandson made a comment about the number of policemen he saw. You can walk the Condado 24 hours a day and feel safe. This was our first trip to PR since the No Smoking laws had gone into effect and I will say it was terrific to be in the Casino with no smoke. (I am a non smoker) I would stay at the Diamond Palace again. I have been staying in hotels and condominiums on the Condado for 22 years, had both of my children in Puerto Rico and live on the neighboring island of St. Croix. If you want a more traditional breakfast Fuddruckers serves breakfast everyday at 7AM for a reasonable price as well as the more expensive Marriot. The hotel is antiquated and could use updating but we had a great time and my worrying was for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Disgusting...RUN to another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: leggata25
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a self admitted Hotel Snob. I worked for Marriott for years and understand the full operations of a hotel. I also understand that you get what you pay for. We booked our room through hotwire for $88 a night and knew that the amenities would be few and far between. We never expected this!! When we checked in, it was dingy but that was ok. We immediately stripped the sheets and comforter off of our beds. The continental breakfast in the morning was pitiful, but free. My family returned to our room in the afternoon to find the door wide opened and unattended while the maid was restocking her cart. When I went in the room, I found a cockroach in my bathroom! On each day of our 4 day stay, I found black hairs of all lengths, shapes and textures on the tile and weaved in to the towels. (Note, my family is all blonde...) There is only one lock on the door which was a bit sketchy to me becuase I always lock the deadbolt and top latch. The pool had plastic bags and other random garbage floating in it. The service, if you want to call it that, was pathetic. Please note, two beacons of hope for the Cubic Zirconia Palace was the maid on the 6th floor and the evening bellman. It's hard to feel ripped off on an $88 night in San Juan but the CZ Palace does that to you! Adding insult to injury, they charged $1 per 800-call dialed!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear!!!”
Reviews.Author: voyagerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamond Palace for 3 days following a Caribbean Cruise, and have nothing but regrets. While this hotel is cheap and in an extremely good location, I was extremely disappointed. To be honest, I can't see how some of our members even thought it was good? The only possible explanation may be that the 2nd tower, through the casino, may be slightly better. Certainly, the Member pictures didnâ€™t look like my room in the older tower. Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the 6th floor in the oldest block. The room was musty & damp (extending to the bedding, carpet & Picture frames). There was mould on the curtains; the balcony doors could not be closed & looked as if they'd never been cleaned. You have to request remote controls - and when we did, it took several requests. The a/c was noisy (old time version - probable cause of damp). The sofas in the reception were dirty. The lady at the reception was abrupt. Half an hour after we checked in, we asked for a new room and were allocated to the 8th floor where at least it wasnâ€™t so musty and the doors closed. On the positive side, there was a fridge in the room and thereâ€™s a free continental breakfast â€“ although we wouldnâ€™t touch it based on the standard of the rooms. The hotelâ€™s in the upmarket part of San Juan called the 'Condado'. Sleek, close to the beach with lots of places to eat and posh boutiques. While are taxi's are always outside, there's a bus stop outside the Marriott charging only 75 cents to Old San Juan (B21 - runs until 9pm). The average price of a taxi is US$12 â€“ 14. Upon arrival, thereâ€™s a free bus service around the town. Would advise that you do the entire route and after that, get on and off at places of interest. If you miss the last bus at 6pm itâ€™s only short walk back to the bus depot. If you can afford it, go for the Marriott in Ashford Avenue instead (the main area where all the shops and boutiques are based). Alternatively try the Raddison â€“ although not so grand, appears to be clean. Our American friends stayed at the Best Western which they described as basic but clean. Our Peurto Rican friends, recommend the Old San Juan â€“ which despite the renovations doesnâ€™t look to bad (but check the reviews). If you donâ€™t mind not being near the shops and restaurants, try the Marriott Courtyard in Miramar. Although expensive for the few hours we stayed there ($190), at least it was of a high standard and only a few minutes to the port. While Puerto Rico is a Caribbean Island, in many ways, it's just like the States in terms of currency, shops and eating places. It also hosts the largest shopping Mall in the Caribbean - Playa de last Americas!!! Old San Juan is certainly a good place to spend the whole day - lots of historical sites and colourful buildings, shops and eating places. All in all, would advise extreme caution when booking hotels in San Juan otherwise you may end up disappointed. Take time reading the reviews and look at the pictures. Had we not been in such a hurry, we may have seen of some of the bad reviews which gave a more accurate description.

Reviews.Title: “Damn Decent For The Money”
Reviews.Author: XxSuntoucherxX
Reviews.Content: After agonizing over where to stay while in Puerto Rico for a long weekend, we decided that it would be best to economize and appreciate the local culture at a non chain hotel. (Tip: This is a pretty lengthy review, so grab a drink.) The Diamond Palace Hotel & Casino was actually better than some of the reviews place it at, but I make that statement conditionally. First, know your threshold. If you're paying $89.00 a night for a hotel, how high are your expectations? Second, are you going to enjoy the island, or are you going to "live" in the hotel? Third, everyone has an opinion and is entitled to it, you do not necessarily have to agree. That said... The room was quite clean, the first thing I checked for was evidence of bed bugs. (I've become conditioned to checking for that first after all of my travels.) I searched for evidence of fleas and roaches as mentioned by others. Nothing. Next, I moved onto the amenities. The TV was as standard as standard gets. It took us 2 days to get a remote for it though. Not a problem for me, however my travel companion, she needed to have one. (Again, what is your threshold?) The balcony was my sanctuary thought the duration of the trip. (How much time do you want to spend in a room with your ex girlfriend?) Once I got the sliding doors un-stuck, it was awesome. We had a decent albeit obstructed view of Condado beach. (Tip: if you're on the front side of the building and have low tolerance of noise, get a higher floor, as the hotel is on the main strip of town on the way to San Juan, there's also a jumping late night diner attached to the hotel on the first floor.) All of the standard hotel gimme's were there. Blow drier, iron, board etc... The bathroom was clean, however the water never really got cold. (Trust me, depending on the time of year you're down there, you'll be looking forward to a cold shower or at the least a drink. Same goes for the water fountains.) The air conditioning was amazing at night, however it's not powerful enough for the tropical humidity during the day. The hotel itself has a bar on the first floor where a Continental Breakfast was served daily. We never ate it as I discovered my home away from home just a half block up the street, Starbucks. The casino is as standard as most Caribbean casino's get. With a handful of table games and nickel slots, it'll keep you busy for a mindless hour if that's your thing. Friday through Sunday nights they had live music @ the bar. Speaking of the bar, drinks are quite expensive. Think NYC club prices. Do yourself a favor and bring your own alcohol to the hotel and stick it in the room fridge. Unless you buy it from a "major" store and you're not a local you will pay A LOT. (Tip: they don't have Guinness anywhere on that island, I was warned ahead of time and smuggled in a case.) The convenience factor was quite significant. It is just a bit over 2 miles to San Juan from the hotel. Cabs to the center from there are about $12.00, cheaper if there's more people in the cab with you. The 21 bus will take you to town for .50. (Tip: Have quarters.) The Wallgreens across the street is open 24 hours, and it's easily one of the largest ones I've seen anywhere outside of NY. (Tip: They close the side entrance after 9:00pm) The beach is a short walk down the block, and it while it's not a glamorous hot spot, it's delightfully reclusive and you have the full run of the Atlantic. There are places to shop, and a few places to eat around the hotel. Check out the Buenas Ares Argentinian restaurant. If you're a wine snob, avoid the Portobello restaurant on the top floor of the hotel. Actually, avoid it all together. It's a decent Italian restaurant, but WAY over priced, and the wine, while the selection is deep, it's awful. Overall, 3 stars. 4 if you don't set your expectations to Marriot level. (Which is right up the street at double the price.) 2, if you're looking for a great hotel without spending any money. It is definitely my first choice to stay at again when I go back in March if I stay in the same area. The proximity to Starbucks alone is worth putting up with not having a remote.

Reviews.Title: “Queen and Princess at the Diamond Palace”
Reviews.Author: RobinLucca
Reviews.Content: This was my daughter's first trip to Puerto Rico. We choose this hotel because we wanted a true Puerto Rican experience. We could have chosen a national branded hotel, but thought "Would these offer the flavor of the island?" We stayed on the 18th floor in a bridal suite. The view of Old San Juan was breathless. The room was spacious with a king size bed, living and dining room area, wet bar kitchen with refrigerator and microwave. We enjoyed the casino and lounge area. The garden restuarant was moderately priced. We enjoyed the island cusine. Other reviewers were not satistied with the continental breakfast, which is the tipical Puerto Rican breafast of Pan (bread roll) Ham and cheese. They also offered cereal, milk and bananas. Island coffee, tea and juices. This was a "Basic Continental" breakfast. We did not see an insect or cleanliness issue at this hotel. The atmosphere is that of the island. If you are a traveler that expects a stay resembling that of the USA mainland resorts, you need to pay the higher rates for the national branded resorts. If you truely want to experience the Puerto Rican Flavor, then this a a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty BAD”
Reviews.Author: theo71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate, but no more than that. Fairly good location. The staff was not really interested at all in the guest. (Actually the maid was, but not the front desk staff). It seems like the staff in the lobby/front desk area were most interested in standing around. I paid too much for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tfmmcf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Diamond Palace Hotel & Casino in Puerto Rico (Palace is definately used in a loose manner) I will say the location of the hotel (and hotel hmmm more like motel) and an hourly one at that, is great it is central to everything, dining, the beach is one block away, BUT the rooms have much to be desired, something from 1975 if you can imagine. And the staff, oh the staff in one word, RUDE!!!!!!! If you are traveling on a budget and if you enjoy a fend for yourself type of atmosphere this place works, if you want to enjoy your vacation and return home well rested, try the Marriot across the street on Ashford Avenue or even better The Best Western on Avenida De Deigo, we checked out of " THE PALACE " early and stayed at The Best Western, now they should be called " The Best Western Palace" staying there felt like a vacation from my vacation at Diamond Palace

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: VacationB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad. The rooms were clean and neat. The bathroom was very clean. Breakfast was good. The only thing I disliked was having to walk through the casino to go to my room. Parking is also a hassel. We paid $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Dump!”
Reviews.Author: CCsunshine7
Reviews.Content: I do not know where to begin with this Diamond dump hotel, or should I say motel. I can't even believe they would even dare call this place a "palace". I am usually not very picky on where I stay as far as hotels go and I have read reviews about this place but I thought maybe people were being too picky. All the bad reviews you read about this hotel are all factual .It looks like the only part of this place they spent the most money on is the lobby, and thats giving them credit because the lobby couches are run down and dirty. Me and my friend shared a room along with two other friends who shared a room. Both rooms were disgusting. The carpets smelled and were dingy, we kept our shoes on the whole time, The curtains were not even of any material I have ever seen, the patio door for both rooms did not close completely. We had to request remote controls for both tvs, and when we asked they "didnt have them". The comforter looked like it was from 1960. We couldnt even cover ourselves with it. The shower head had mildew on it. Parts of the walls around the closet were cracked. The pool, wow, what can I say about the pool.I put one finger in the pool and I can smell the disgusting, rotten, infested water that noone ever even swam in. The elevator did not work properly, it would take about 10 minutes for it to even open up and this was not a busy hotel at all. The most frustration with this dump came at the end when the so called manager said we all owe $100 for "San Juan City Tax", we asked for some kind of document, or written receipt, to show this tax amount but he told us he has it on paper but doesn't have it at the moment. We called our travel agent who we booked the trip through and they had no idea what this extra tax cost was and argued it with the manager themselves. we refused to pay and he insisted that our cards will be charged regardless. He was very rude and didn't even have one clue about taxes to explain it to us as a manager of the motel. The only thing I can say good about this hotel is that it has a 24 hour walgreens right across the street, walking distance. And the beach is right out the hotel as well. But trust me, it is not worth staying here. I would definitly pay extra and stay right around the corner at the Marriott. They give everyone star treatment there whether you are a guest or not. I couldn't believe the difference in customer service. Stay at the Marriott, you will have a beachfront view and a time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here - I need your help!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jd2be1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Memorial Day 2007. IT WAS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN. There were roaches everywhere and fleas. I have pictures of the roaches and fleas to post for your review (when I download them) STAFF: Extremely rude. The manager, Mildred Rodriguez and hotel staff member Roxanne were simply the worst of the worst. After seeing multiple roaches we had to change rooms, where we were placed in another room with fleas. Furthermore, the staff offered absolutely no compensation for their horrible service. ROOMS: I don't even want to reflect on the rooms but just to name a few things: Roaches, fleas, non working lights, balcony doors that stayed open all night, leak in the bathroom, toilet that doesn't flush and a non working TV remote, dirty sheets and the towels were even worse. LOCATION: the hotel is one block away from a beach but not the good beach. The beach that is close has rocks in it. We have to pay $20 per day to catch a cab to Isle Verde where we finally found blue water. EVERYTHING ELSE: Casino - bad, breakfast- bad, pool-bad, I have simply nothing positive at all to say about this hotel. If you have suffered injuries I suggest you pursue this hotel legally for the full amount of your expenses and injuries(contact me)....(I still itch from the fleas)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Brendon87
Reviews.Content: This place is the WORST hotel I've ever stayed at and I've stayed at 30+ hotels. The rooms are constantly damp and smelly, the service is TERRIBLE. It took about 2 hours to bring a remote for the TV, over 30 minutes for towels, and over and hour for a wash cloth. Towels have stains all over them too. Worst staff I have ever come across - not friendly or helpful in any way. I would advise you all to stay away from this place. Even though it is only a block away from the beach, there are better options that are just as close to the beach or even closer.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review by individuals that do not have high standards.”
Reviews.Author: navinag
Reviews.Content: Ok. We were going on a cruise and Apr 22-Apr30 and found this place to be the cheapest. WE flew in a day early to check out the city . All of the staff is not friendly. Some of them are but not at the desk. We staiyed here two nights Apr 22 and Apr29. The place needs a bit work as fas as maintence is concerned, but that is not the issue. Rooms are musty, not cleaned well (hairs left behind on the sheets), water is not warm. I guess if you consider the temperature of beach water acceptable, then that is ok. Beds are very old. I woke up on Apr 30 with a rash from something on the bed, probably some bed bugs. I have heard good reviews from other people but they might give the nighters the worst rooms possible. The olny upside is the 1/2 block to the beach and close to public bus stop. I would probably find a decent hotel on the outshirts of the city where the public bus runs or taxis are readily available and about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: budget-in-mind
Reviews.Content: you get what you pay for so dont expect it to be a four star hotel. however the location and the view from my room was great. the restuarant was a bit pricey but you have so many other option just a short walk away( unos, wendys, burger king) for thus on a budget. also a 24 hour walgreens across the street and a .laundrymat next door.ask for a room in the main tower. the upkeep is a little better i guess because the casino and the restuarant( which is crowded at night) is located in this building. the staff was friendly but very few spoke english. all and all my vacation was great and i would recommend this hotel unless you want to spend 300 at the marriot

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as thought by the reviews”
Reviews.Author: bkiron
Reviews.Content: it was no marriott,but it is acrossed the street from one. we did not spend much time there. the pool sucks. the rooms were clean.the suits(mgrs) in the lobby were not friendly. all the poeple staying there were extreamly nice good location. if you want a really nice hotel dont stay at the diamond.if you do the beach and site seeing all day and party at night and only shower and change clothes. stay there , 1 block from starbucks way cool cherry blossem japan steak house was awesome. marriott has a great casino, beach,.keep this in mind you can stay at the diamond and hang out at marriott . if your white they dont even check to see if your a guest .we used there beach chairs,just as if they were ours, but i did see them take chairs away from latinos who were doing the same thing we were.hotel was at best ok. have stayed at worse

Reviews.Title: “This hotel need some major, major repairs...”
Reviews.Author: TamishaPorter
Reviews.Content: Diamond Palace Hotel and Casino is not the place to go if your going on a vacation. If you need some place to stay just to go to the doctor or to do some shopping then that's fine. The place needs some major, major repairs and refurbishing. You can tell that the building is old. It has several cracks in the walls. The drapes in the rooms needs some major cleaning. They were filled with mold an mildew. Also, the A/C vents need to clean because they were also filled with mold and mildew. I woke up in the morning and saw small cockroaches in the bathroom. The lobby area has a terrible stinch of old smoke. If it would make anyone feel better, the bellman was really sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: cynabon
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and it was great except for the hotel. The Diamond Palace Hotel and Casino was absolutely by far the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. I guess the $89 a night that I paid was probably the reason that it was horrible. I guess that saying is true when they say "You get what you pay for". First of all upon check-in the hotel staff failed to inform me of a certain amount of money they charge to your card as a hold in case of anything like damage to the room, charges applied etc. I booked thru hotels.com and in the confirmation I received didnt say anything of the sort either. However the amount supposedly that they are supposed to hold is about $200 at the most but apparently the incompetent staff member charged my debit card for $550 in error. This really put a damper on my spending while on vacation because I didn't know that this was deducted till one day that I took money out of the ATM and noticed I was overdraft on my account. While I did get this squared away with the hotel, I was not satisfied in the manner that this was handled. No apology was given to me as I so deserved nor any type of consideration of my inconvenience was showed even by the manager. She just shrugged me off like I was taking too much of her precious time. They didnt even cover any of my overdraft fees incurred by this incompetent error. I truly do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Flypinay19
Reviews.Content: We did not have the roach issues that others had but it definitely smelled of mildew! I would NOT recommend this place to anyone! Everything in the hotel is old. The pool looked dirty which is why I did not allow my children to swim in it. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the one block walk to a beautiful beach. We only stayed one night, Thank God, but for those of you planning on a several day visit to San Juan, Puerto Rico....DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HOTEL.. It is THAT bad!!!!!!! After returning from our weeklong cruise, we stayed at another hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico and when we told the taxi driver that we had stayed at this hotel he said that this hotel has the WORST reputation and that it should be called the Roach Palace hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Evaluation of Diamond Palace by a hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: chuckcory
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to PR and just returned from our trip. We stayed at the Diamond Palace Hotel in San Juan. As avid travelers and experience as a hotel manager, I would STRONGLY recommend everyone to avoid this hotel unless you are an experienced traveler and only wish to "taste and feel" the local flavor of the area. As an experienced hotel manager in the US, the Diamond Palace has a lot of potential, but needs some serious $$$ to make it an enjoyable place to stay. The Diamond Palace website is very misleading and gives you the impression that it is a 4+ Star Hotel. Nothing could be farther from the truth. We arrived in PR about 1am after a good flight via Atlanta from Colorado. Upon arriving, we got our rental car from AVIS, which was excellent. Good shuttle service, nice car, etc. So.... we got lost going to our hotel which was about a 15 minute drive, at 1:30am on a Sunday night. After asking a local who almost robbed us, we found a police car on the street, told him we were lost. He chuckled and said, "follow me". Lights flashing on his car, we followed him and in about 2 minutes we were at the hotel. He was very nice. We checked in. Small lobby, smelled like a public bathroom. Small casino, nice people. It is a 1960's type hotel. Kind of tired. Took the elevator to our room. Small bed, wall-mounted A/C unit which was noisy. Refrig, small TV, no remote ( you have to request one), tired bathroom, a view of other buildings and the pool. Broken lamp, bed OK, in-room safe had no lock on it. No coffee pot. Again, the room smelled like a public bathroom. There's some kind of disinfectent that they use there that makes everything smell like that. Great location a block from the beach. Walgreens across the street open 24 hours a day. Daily free breakfast served at the bar. Strong PR coffee, cold cereal, bananas and they will make you a sandwich of toast, ham and cheese. Maybe this is a local tradition, but two pieces of toast with slices of ham and cheese is not my idea of breakfast. Also orange juice. Casino small and mostly for locals. Slots and 4 or 5 tables. Not a good casino. They have a small restaurant which serves very average food. Kind of a scaled down Deneny's. They have a roof top Italian restaurant which we did not go to. All in all, on a scale of 1-10, we would rate it a 3+. The only good part about it is it's location. Parking behind the hotel which charges $10 per day. Not many creature comforts. No room service. Tired bar. On the positive side: location, friendly people (everyone in PR seems very nice.) Walgreens across the street. They have photo service so you can print or make a CD of photos from your digital camera. Snacks and everything else that a Walgreens has. Many restaurants close by including local PR food, Wendy's, Subway, etc. Next trip, we will stay in the Isla Verde area which is near the airport, has a great beach and seems a lot safer than the Condado area. Sorry Diamond Palace, but I was glad to leave after staying there 5 nights. It needs a remodel and upgrade, better food. Oh, they have a $5.00 lunch made by locals by the pool. Great local PR food. This was a great place for lunch if you happen to be near the hotel. You have to use the pool before noon as the shadow from the building makes it all shade in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “I felt confortable at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: laprietalaprieta
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay. The people were nice especially the housekeeping staff, the room was comfortable and clean. I will come back again by the end of this year.

Reviews.Title: “I actually didn't stay. I flew all night and half the day to get to San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: skywaitress
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 1:30 p.m. The clerk didn't care that I had flown all night and half the day to get there with no sleep for over 24 hours. She simply brushed me off with a "we don't have any rooms -- check-in is at 3:00." I called another hotel close by and was immediately taken in. I think a hotel should at least try to accommodate guests, especially when they have come a great distance to get there; and especially when the place is obviously empty. There were no guests waiting to check in; the casino was very nearly empty; there were several bellmen standing around; and three clerks at the front desk doing nothing. I'm in the process of disputing this hotel's charge to my credit card for one night. If my credit card allows the charge, it will be sending a message to these types of hotels that it's okay to provide unacceptable customer service and be paid in return.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: n0clule
Reviews.Content: They need to upgrade the hotel big time, the carpet are sticky, it takes a while for the lift if you stay in the higher floors One good thing about it is there's a Wal green opposite to the building. And there's compliementry "breakfast" which is toast/cereral/coffee in the bar If you only need to stay more than 1 nite, I would advice you to go else where.

Reviews.Title: “I highly do not recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: scene
Reviews.Content: We stayed their 1 night. We went to our room, Glass door could not lock, etc. We had to be moved to another room. The next room that we went to was ok. I must say though that everything in the room was working, except the safe. The hotel was run down, it needs some renovations done. Staff was ok, but some members needed some training. Breakfast was ok, but they could have had some eggs along with the sandwich or cereal. Walgreens was right opposite. We really could not sleep that night. We do not recommend it to anyone, not even your worst enemy. We will not stay their again. We met some people their who also thought it was awful. Power went off, did not have a generator, and told people that they could not get a receipt . They did not even hand write one. They said you would have to get it from expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Diamond Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: its2lisap
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at your Hotel from August 1st 2006 until August 7th 2006. I have bought up a couple of concerns while I was there and I really didn't get anything resolved. First I would like to start out with that during the entirety of our stay we had no hot water and very little pressure. We had told someone at the front desk and nothing was done. Secondly, when we made our reservations we requested a queen size bed and we were given a full size bed which seemed to be very small. We also complained and nothing was done. Third, we had roaches all throughout our room and we complained and again nothing was done. Then on the day we were checking out the electric was turned off early in the morning and we as guest should had been notified days prior of such event so that we can be prepared. Due to the electric being turned off, we had no other choice but to take the stairs, which was a huge inconvenience. Did the person who made the decision to turn off the power really think this through before taking action and not worrying about the guest and the inconvenience they have caused?
