How about the elderly people that were in higher floors that had to take the stairs??? Really??? Was there any concerns with it being hot and maybe someone can get sick or worse. I have stayed at many hotels and I had never experienced anything like this. Having to sleep in the same room with roaches and no hot water was not my ideal vacation. I was very disappointed with my entire stay at this Hotel. I have made my complaints to the clerks at the front desk and the response was that is that being that I made my reservations on-line I would have to contact the website about my experience at this Hotel. Now why would I contact another company about the way this hotel is managed and about the problems that we had during our stay? Very disappointed with the tire stay. I wouldn't even recommend this Hotel to my worst enemy... So please really check things out before booking here...

Reviews.Title: “Glorified ROACH MOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: jazzy17
Reviews.Content: This place is a DUMP!! The pictures on the site are deceiving. Its dirty and bad smell in the hallways. Glorified roach motel.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elsa_carabina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for six nights, I was a little apprehensive at first after I had read some of the reviews here. I can happily say that our stay was wonderful. We showed up and it is true that you will not be allowed to check in prior to three pm, so we checked our luggage in and headed out to town, there is a public transportation stop across the street that for .75 cents will take you to San Juan, so we took advantage of this and went to see the town. We came back around 6pm and we checked into our room, we were in a corner room on the 7th floor. Room was clean, it looked as if it was recently painted, sheets were clean and the bed was restfull enough to get a good night sleep. Hair dryer and Iron all worked well. This is a no frills hotel, the location is excellent and as long as you are realistic in your expectations you will enjoy your stay. We had no problems with the hot water as I read here someone did. This is not the hilton or the sheraton, for the price of 80 dllrs a night you get the basic comforts of a room to rest your head after a day out on the town. Oh and the poolside kitchen was great! 5 dollars for a plate filled with food. We plan to go again and next time take the kids, we will be booking our stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this Hotel, words cannot describe how bad it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ten different parties took rooms in this hotel, as we had a wedding to attend in San Juan, We all agreed that this was one big mistake. The service is bad, the help is bad and could care less about anything you request. The rugs are stickey, the walls dirty, I have been all over the USA and all who stayed there agreed on one thing, a motel 6 is much much better. I had three different rooms, I finally said the heck with it and said would go for more money and asked for their best suite, while this was larger, it was just as bad over all. Will point out, if you have more then one in a room, figure to space out showers at half to an hour between them, as the hot water is enough for only one at a time. The restaurant was not bad and will give credit where credit is due. So when going to San Juan stay anywhere else, as anywhere is better then there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, it's dangerous”
Reviews.Author: MamaofEnS
Reviews.Content: This place seemed much better in the ads. When we pulled up in a taxi, we were sure is was the wrong hotel, but it was the one we had reservations at. It is near the beach, but does not have anywhere to change and go to the beach before check in time. They are very strict about this, and would not negotiate. We had a suite on the 14th floor. It felt very high up especially since the building seemed so old, and looked like it might fall apart any second. Even riding the elevators were scary! At night, my husband discovered over a dozen cockroaches! Also, the fold out bed was missing springs, so it didn't provide support for my kids. The pool was tiny. No spa, just a kids wading pool. We didn't go into the casino, so I can't rate that. The free continental breakfast was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel the night before we went on a cruise and the night that we got off from our cruise. We had both nights booked weeks in advance. Both rooms that we stayed in were totally disgusting and dirty feeling. The first night we were there, we noticed that there was no hardware to lock the sliding glass door that went out to the balcony. If you stepped out onto the balcony and looked left or right, you could see that someone could hop the wall from either of the rooms that were on each side of us. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone up to check to see what we were talking about. The gentleman seemed rather surprised, but said he would see if he could find something to put in the track of the door so that it couldn't be opened from inside or outside. He never came back. Needless to say we didn't feel really safe that night since we had never stayed in San Juan before and didn't know what the safety level was. Since we were on a cruise ship for a week, we really didn't have a chance to see if we could make other arrangements to stay somewhere else at the end of our trip. When we got to our room that second night, we found the same problem with the door again in a totally different room. Since nobody bothered with it the first time, and it was quite late when we got in, we knew nobody would do anything about the door in this room either. Needless to say, we will NEVER go back to that hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Roach Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy insects, moldy walls, chipping paint, broken closet doors and a whole slew of other unmentionable disgusting things, then The Diamond Palace is the place for you! Believe me when I say that there was nothing Palatial or royal about this dump! The Diamond Palace is the worse hotel on the strip! I killed 4 roaches in one night and the continental breakfast was horrible! Thank goodness we only stayed there for one unimpressive night. The best thing was the fact that there was a happy hour! I would much rather pay extra to sleep in comfort and not worry about a roach crawling into my mouth!! I will never ever stay there again! Diamond Palace gets a "no star" rating! Ick!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst ever hotels”
Reviews.Author: UnkCom
Reviews.Content: I used to travel about 200 days a year and have spent many nights in hotels. I must say that this is one of the worst, if not the worst, hotel I have ever had the displeasure in which to stay. The elevators were slow and did not line up with the floors when they stopped. The closet door would not open so only half of the closet was available to us. There were holes in the ceilings that had been cut and the pieces screwed back in. You could see the outside all around the air conditioner which allowed bugs, heat and street noise in. The safe had no lock (made it just a storage container screwed onto the wall). The bathroom floors were grungy. There were rusty protrusions in the shower (looked like what was left of rusted out screws from a grab bar). I saw a cockroach on the wall right outside the room. The employees were less than friendly. My sister and her fiancÃ© stayed in the same hotel and their room was no better. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE AT ALL COST!

Reviews.Title: “We checked in May 24 2006.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was better than expected! The staff is very friendly and helpful always there to please the guests! We were on the 8th floor room 804 directly in front of the elevator, too convienent! The room was clean, well kept and the bathroom was spacious and included hair dryer! One less thing to pack! The food was great at the pool side restaurant $5.00 lunches fed two people if need be! Also the casino was fun, especially when my friend hit $100 at the 5 cent machine! So we couldn't complain. The location is very nice (Condado area) and convenient to the beach just a block away! 24 hr Walgreens to pick up anything you can think of! And the great Latin Star Restaurant right around the corner which served great pina coladas and breakfast! Night life well that's in Isla Verde our area catered more to the Gay community it was like the VILLAGE in NYC! If you catch my drift! lol Overall the hotel was affordable, very well located and we'd definitley stay there again! We were frightend after reading the reviews and tried to change hotels but we happy to say we didn't experience any horror stories! Yours truly, NJ guests

Reviews.Title: “Fleas All Over!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never knew how horrible could be to stay in a cheap hotel unitl now. My company gave a very small budget and after a terrible experience in the Hotel Plaza de Armas (Howard Johnson) in Old San Juan, I had to book 5 nites with this place. The first morning I woke up scratching my legs and I thought it was my allergies. The second night I found fleas all over the bed!!! the bathroom, the walls!!! I called the front desk and they told me to present a complaint with housekeeping! I had to do it myself! I they would not move me to another room, they wanted to clean it with my stuff in there!! I had to run!!!! Please never ever come here. Know I have to sanitice my entire luggage before getting back home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only Rhinestones NO Diamond”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bathroom needs a rush up lift. Paint job is badly needed. Closet doors are old and got stuck. The room was clean and comfortable but old furniture. Hallways could use a sound barrier. A block away to a nice beach. Across the street a big Walgreen for snacks, drinks and souvenirs. If you are on a tight budget stay here otherwise do not stay because you will be dissapointed. If you want the room just to go to sleep is OK. Lots of places to go eat. Danny's Pizza around the corner was great! People were nice and friendly. The "continental breakfast" is ham/cheese and toast, cereal, fruits which was good but not every single day! Casino was smokey. We took the city bus for 75 cents to Old San Juan. Parking behind hotel is not free - very expensive. Quest got a discount at $10.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “not a nightmare, just a bad dream”
Reviews.Author: albertiger
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the staff: Surly is the word that comes to mind but look past that and its not the nightmare some made it out to be. My room, some ceiling panels were stained or didnt fit properly and the rug had some ugly patches, but the bed was comfortable (no bedbugs or cucharachas!) it had a balcony with a view of the ocean but no patio furniture. Ashford Ave. is EXTREMELY loud at night (bring earplugs). There were plenty of towels, toiletries were provided and the tv had lots of channels. Location was great, however i consider this a learning experience and would not repeat my stay here. For the price i paid on Hotwire i could have gotten the Radisson down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say I had to stay in this crap hole for 5 days..luckily I have been to PR before and I know where the good beach/pools are and had no problem hanging out in those hotels/resorts. 1st..took an hour to check in..and had about 10 others waiting at the same time 2nd. electricity and plumbing went out on & off at least once a day 3rd. no clean towels, room was gross and had to have maintenence man pry open balcony door. only good thing i can say is that i only saw one bug the whole time! oh and the bellman were very nice! Casino sucked..food sucked..front desk people sucked.. BUT I still LOVE PR.. My recommendation for anyone is to stay at the Condado Plaza & casino(formerly Wyndham) Stayed there last yr and i missed it this year!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go anywhere near this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete and utter dump! The lobby is deceiving because of the casino and the people gambling and seemingly having a good time. It seems more like a hang out for youngerster. The rooms and hotel floors are another sad story. The lobbies are small, seem to be closing in on you and in bad need of repairs. The elevators are decent on the inside but I was surprised that I had to wait nearly 10 minutes before getting downstairs. The rooms are another story. They were clean but the furniture was worn, as if it had all been purchased from a second hand shop!! My family and I were afraid to sleep in the bed!! We didn't even last a day and checked out immediately!! The pool looked worn and old. Not a place to stay if you have small kids as the rooms are high above and have glass sliding doors that reveal a small and dangerous balcony. If you can't afford anything else, I suggest you stay home and save up until you can but stay away from here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As students, we wanted to find somewhere relatively cheap to stay. Diamond Palace seemed like it had a decent location and price. Check in was the start of the nightmare. They only had one girl working the front desk and she took forever to get through each set of customers. The rooms smelled like they hadn't been cleaned in weeks. We asked for air freshener to be sent up so we could at least live there without choking. We had a flexible itinerary, so we only booked the first two and last day of our trip (we'd travel outside San Juan the rest of the time) under the assurance that we could get the 3rd day if we wanted. However, when we decided to stay in San Juan on the 3rd day, the hotel was suddenly full and they kicked us out! Thankfully, we found a much nicer place around the corner - Coral Princess Inn - at around the same price. After travelling the island for a couple of days, we wanted to come back to San Juan, but we wanted to cancel our reservation at DP and change to CPI. We called 6 times a day to try and cancel, but they kept transferring us around and sayng to call back because the person who dealt with cancellations wasn't around! Finally when we got thru the next day, they told us that they would charge us the FULL price because we didn't call 72 hrs in advance! We were trying to, but they wouldn't take our calls! So we ended up staying at DP and there were no towels in the bathroom. It took me 3 calls over an hour before they finally sent some up. It's almost like you'd have to try hard to be that bad. Worst service ever. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_teachinChina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and everything worked in the hotel with a simple breakfast included and only $10 a night for car parking. Check-in is at 3PM so if you arrive early, you may have to sit and wait as we did. Desk clerk was not very pleasant in the process. The shower only had luke warm water, but plenty of towels and they were clean as was the room. It is convenient to old San Juan, the beach and the expressway out of town.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a star makes..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a difference a star makes....We are used to stay at 4-stars hotels or better when we travel(especially Marriott Hotels). Unfortunately there was no availability in the Condado area. So we decided to to stay at a 3-star hotel instead..It can't be that much different, right???? Wrong! This hotel is good for college kids who are just looking for a cheap place to sleep after a night of partying and drinking, in other words a place to pass-out, not for families or couples who are looking to enjoy a good stay. The rooms are moldy, and the beds are old and lumpy. You will find roach traps in every corner of the room and bathroom..and if you don't leave a light on at night, or leave any trace of food around, you are likely to be surprised by roaches at any time. We had to call housekeeping several times just to get sets of clean towels after the first night. Eating at the hotel??? I don't thinks so.. The only and best part about our stay was the day we checked out..could not wait to get out!! and check into a real hotel..Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: commscholar
Reviews.Content: This place really is a dump. The elevators are painfully slow, the lobby is tiny, the balcony doors don't open, the furnishings are incredibly worn, like no molding around the floor. It looked like it was torn off and they never put it back. However, I never saw a single bug. I'm pretty forgiving, and I stay in lots of budget hotels, but this place was pretty bad. I thought the free breakfast was fine, just like other continental breakfasts, and the location was excellent. I specifically asked for a quiet room and had no problem with noise, but the wind howling through the cracked open balcony door kept me up all night (but I can't blame the hotel for the wind). In the end, I wished I'd stayed in a Holiday Inn Express for $10/night more. But the place was dirt cheap, and it was stayable. I wasn't afraid or anything. If you're looking for a cheap place to sleep and aren't going to be in your room much, the place is possible. However, if you can find another hotel for a similar price, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain for the Budget Conscious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diamond Palace Hotel and Casino Friday December 2-Saturday December 10. If I had read all of these reviews before making my hotel reservations I would have been scared off from staying here. However, I made my hotel reservations through Hotwire and so I had no choice but to follow through with my plans. I was thankful for the few positive and/or realistic reviews that were written especially as it got closer and closer to my departure. I traveled with my mom and sister and both of them said that they would stay there again. I would too, especially for the price we paid ($65 a night). Since we needed to book 9 nights we were particularly budget conscious. We werenâ€™t looking for much, just a place to lay our heads in between all of the sightseeing. Each morning we ate the continental breakfast (7 to 10 am), which consisted of 2 cereals, bananas, or apples (note: the bananas go quickly), ham and cheese sandwiches (or just toast) coffee/tea, hot chocolate, juice and milk. We stayed on the 10th floor (in the main tower) where we had a partial view of the ocean and being so high up we never heard any noise from the casino or the streets. Every time we took the elevator it worked (however, once I day we would take the stairs for exercise) My first contact with the hotel staff was before our trip when I called and spoke with Michelle Rodriguez (assistant hotel manager) to request a room with 2 beds. No problems there. Since we were arriving in San Juan 3:15 am on Friday, I booked a room from Thursday so as to make sure we would be able to check in at that late/early time. I was greeted at the front desk by David, who handled our check-in efficiently and in a friendly manner. Throughout our stay the friendly doorman Juan also assisted us. Not everyone was as friendly or outgoing as the ones I just mentioned, but I didnâ€™t encounter any rude individuals either. Our room had a small fridge and was cleaned on a daily basis (I think one of the reviews indicated that it wasnâ€™t) and when we wrote a note to the maid service asking them to leave extra sets of towels they obliged. (leaving a small tip could have played a part in that as well ;-) I never saw any roaches, nor did I bring any home in my luggage. Itâ€™s true our room had a certain smell about it (not sure if it was the dampness in the air or perhaps our air conditioner needing a new filter) however, it was tolerable and a plug in air freshener definitely helped. Besides the condition of the hotel was its ideal location. We were at the 24 hr Walgreens across the street from the hotel every day to print our digital photos. Around the corner is Starbucks and down the street there is an Internet cafÃ©, Pizza Hut, Subway, Baskin Robbins/Dunkin Donuts and Wendyâ€™s, along with the Latin Star restaurant open 24 hours a day. I didnâ€™t feel the neighborhood was unsafe; there were times when we were out very late/early in the morning and while we always went in pairs, I never felt threatened. Also a block away (past the taxi stand) is the Condado beach. The part of the beach that is the most accessible from the hotel is nothing exciting. Thereâ€™s some litter, some graffiti, some rocks (they made for good props in our photos) however, if you walk further down youâ€™ll reach the part of the beach thatâ€™s better maintained. We rented a car for most of our stay and unfortunately I canâ€™t speak on the parking situation at the Diamond Palace because we parked on the street a few blocks away from the hotel. Based on my experience I would stay there again especially if I were traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “How bad can it be!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: este77
Reviews.Content: Where can I start with this review. Ok, I know where. The front desk was unfriendly and unwilling to help. We were supposed to have a double and ended having a single. Three people to a single was not good. The unhelpful front desk woman (blond hair for those that still decide to go), did not even attempt to look in the computer to see if a room was available. She just keep stating no rooms were avaiable. After standing there and going back and forth for about 20 mins we just decided to give it a try. Once we arrived in the room the bell boy broke the pull handle on one of the suitcases. The room was a TERRIBLE!!!! No bigger than a 8 x 10 room. The bed was lumpy and the footboard side was resting higher than the headboard side. Picture a one of those craftmatic without the matic. The tv was a 19" on a corner of the room with a swivel stool. The balcony had a view of the parking lot. Mind you the sliding door did not have a handle and did not slide with any type of ease. The only thing nice in the room was the bathroom, but once we turned on the lights it was not nice. We had the lights off. We tried every single day we were there to change room offering to pay more. TO no avail. The elevators are slow and sometimes take so long to come up that its faster to use the stairs. The pool, ha ha, if you want to call it that was dirty and the towels they give you. They were salvation army rejects. None of the towels matched they were discolored and had bleach stains on them. The bartendar was not attentive to us at all. The parking lot had a fee of $10 a every 24 hrs. The restaurnt was not good either. They messed up our order. The only thing good about this hotel is the location. There is a Walgreens or CVS across the street. An excellent Argentinian restaurant down the street, Starbucks around the corner and the beach was a block away. The hotel room was also kept clean by housekeeping. we booked this hotel it was only a few dollars cheaper than the Radisson. Major regret!! We had some friends that were staying there and it was the Ritz Carlotn compared to ours. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only reason we went with this one was that one of my friends stated "How bad can it be." Trust me it can be very very bad. For those who still go the rm # I am talking about is RM 308.
